question.title: What is a characteristic of a rash at the secondary syphilis stage?
question.description: A multiple-choice question about the secondary syphilis stage

option_a.title: It is always painful
option_a.description: A possible description of the rash, but not necessarily accurate

option_b.title: It is usually itchy
option_b.description: A common misconception about rashes in general, but not specific to syphilis

option_c.title: It is typically located on the palms of the hands
option_c.description: A characteristic of the palmar syphilis stage, not the secondary stage

option_d.title: It is often accompanied by fever
option_d.description: A possible symptom of secondary syphilis, but not a characteristic of the rash itself

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct answer, indicating that the rash is often described as a maculopapular rash
